messages.message:
Tips on port-forwarding: Probably a lot of us know this already. We can do various port-forwarding to make the Crafting sandbox available at `http://localhost` by running the command:
```sudo sh -c "CRAFTING_SANDBOX_SERVER_URL=https://instabase.sandboxes.site cs pf -P -F \
	-L 80:localhost:80 \
	-L 7600:localhost:7600 \
	-L 8600:localhost:8600 \
	-L 9600:localhost:9600 \
	-L 3306:mysql:3306 \
	-W $CRAFTING_SANDBOX" // <sandbox_name>/dev ex 'xindixu-v4/dev'```
Port 80 makes the API and the UI available at `http://localhost`. This is useful if you need to bypass Crafting <> Okta SSO. Some use cases are:
1. Log in with Google or mount Google Drive
2. Log in with SAML
3. Make api calls via Postman
4. Run Cypress tests on your laptop against your sandbox to test changes
Port 7600, 8600, 9600, and many more make gRPC endpoints available on `http://localhost` so that we can make gRPC calls via Postman easily.
Port 3306 makes the MySQL DB available so that we can use any DB GUI to view and edit the DB.
